clues.text: A perambulator or pram to the Brits, it was invented in 1733 by William Kent for the Duke of Devonshire's kids
In 1676 Robert Hooke came up with a universal one of these to manipulate the mirrors of his helioscope
The name of this Scot who invented the steam hammer sounds just like the American who invented basketball
For the military, zoologist John Kerr developed the "dazzle paint" type of this, something animals also use

1980 scarefest in which mom & daughter switch bodies one day & are stalked by Jason at Camp Crystal Lake
Leif Ericson's dad who was a huge star with low surface temperature
Fictional girl sleuth who's the granddaughter of "The Great Profile"
Projection at the southern tip of South America also called a cornucopia
clues.response: Cape Horn of Plenty (Cape Horn o' Plenty accepted)

clues.text: "Lethal Weapon" director whose group was caught in a Sierra Nevada pass in the winter of 1846-47

2 of the most performed songs in the U.S. after "Happy Birthday"; both were sung March 31, 2008 at Dodger Stadium
clues.response: the National Anthem & "Take Me Out To The Ball Game"

clues.text: The first section of the boardwalk along this New Jersey seashore resort opened on June 26, 1870
Alexander Hamilton was the first secretary of this government department
Florida was named in honor of this holiday season, whose Spanish name includes the word florida
Some folks think of the nectarine as this, Georgia's state fruit, without the fuzz
This fruit can precede "sauce", "butter" & "-pie order"
The Royal Ann type of this fruit is often canned or used to make maraschinos

Swedish university city where Celsius & Angstrom taught

rounds.comments: (Alex: Each clue will require two words in the response.)

clues.text: Norse mariner Mr. Eriksson's first name, sans F, is tropical neckwear
A directional word for the liberal side of politics goes F-less & turns into a word meaning to allow
A clique within a larger group gets rid of its F to be a movie director's shout to start a scene
Wrap yourself around this piece of clothing, but careful!  Losing an F will leave this mark left by a healed wound
Lasting a short time, without an F, becomes a French cheese
This river of the American Southwest shares its name with a "monster" that inhabits the area
This river is actually a strait that "falls" 326 feet from Lake Erie to Lake Ontario
This river grows to 11 miles in width as it reaches Chesapeake Bay at Point Lookout, Maryland
Although 150 miles to the east, this river supplies most of San Diego's water
This river was discovered in 1805 by Lewis & Clark, who called it the Lewis Fork of the Columbia River

On January 4, 2007, in the House of Reps., she said, "I accept this gavel in the spirit of partnership, not partisanship"

In "Twilight" by Stephenie Meyer, teenaged Isabella Swan falls for a romantic one of these blood-suckers

rounds.text: This is the only state that honors a former U.S. Secretary of State with his own legal holiday
